title: R Implementation of OpenTelemetry, Exporters
text: OpenTelemetry SDK R packages projects High-quality, ubiquitous, portable telemetry enable effective observability. OpenTelemetry collection tools, APIs, SDKs used instrument, generate, collect, export telemetry data (metrics, logs, traces) analysis order understand software’s performance behavior. Use otel package dependency want instrument R package project OpenTelemetry. Use package (otelsdk) produce OpenTelemetry output R package project instrumented otel package.

title: R Implementation of OpenTelemetry, Exporters
text: [!WARNING] package experimental may introduce breaking changes time. probably works best latest commit otel package. can install development version otel GitHub :

title: R Implementation of OpenTelemetry, Exporters
text: compile otelsdk source, need install protobuf library first: Windows install correct version Rtools. Linux install appropriate package distribution. macOS, can use CRAN’s protobuf build Homebrew. using CRAN’s build, must uninstall unlink Homebrew protobuf:

title: R Implementation of OpenTelemetry, Exporters
text: Instrument R package project using otel package. Choose exporter otelsdk package. http exporter sends OpenTelemetry output OTLP/HTTP. Set OTEL_TRACES_EXPORTER environment variable point exporter choice. E.g. OTLP/HTTP set OTEL_TRACES_EXPORTER=http. sending telemetry data HTTP, typically need configure URL OpenTelemetry collector, possibly also need supply token HTTP header, possibly resource attributes. Follow instructions provider collector. typically don’t instructions R, generic instructions environment variables work otelsdk R package. E.g. Grafana need something like See example . Start R app. Telemetry data exported chosen exporter.

title: R Implementation of OpenTelemetry, Exporters
text: lot services offer OpenTelemetry collector tracers, logs metrics, many supporting three . also local apps work collector. tried otelsdk following ones:

title: R Implementation of OpenTelemetry, Exporters
text: Follow documentation. Create API token. ’ll need use Grafana instrance ID username, token password HTTP Basic auth. E.g. R get base64 encoded token. instance-id (currently seven digit) number string glc_ prefix. use encoded token set Authorization header: endpoint URL probably different, use one see dashboard. want export logs /metrics, set environment variables, respectively: also makes sense set desired log level. Grafana suggests running OpenTelemetry collector premise instead sending telemetry data directly. nevertheless can start without running collector, call “quick start” mode.

title: R Implementation of OpenTelemetry, Exporters
text: Create project write token. Note URLs need use different within EU! probably need replace us eu URL EU. Set environment variables: logs also set OTEL_LOGS_EXPORTER desired log level: exporting metrics also set

title: R Implementation of OpenTelemetry, Exporters
text: otel-tui terminal app supports traces, logs metrics. great development, can keep telemetry local instrumenting package app. Follow installation instructions run app terminal: listens default port, setup simple, set environment variables (subset don’t want metrics logs):

title: R Implementation of OpenTelemetry, Exporters
text: otel-desktop-viewer similar otel-tui, web UI. Follow installation instructions start app terminal: start new windows tab local web browser. Set usual environment variable R app:

title: R Implementation of OpenTelemetry, Exporters
text: Docker, can start Jaeger container default port: Go http://localhost:16686/ view Jaeger UI.

title: R Implementation of OpenTelemetry, Exporters
text: run SigNoz locally Docker, clone repository https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz: run Docker Compose deploy/docker/ subdirectory: Go http://localhost:8080 see SigNoz UI.
code: git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz cd deploy/docker docker compose up

Use package export traces, metrics, logs 'OpenTelemetry Protocol' ('OTLP').
